content: 22 24 sts from the ws inside of the mitten - the back of the top sts this may be difficult due to the cable pattern so don t be afraid to cast on a few stitches in places where you can t pick one up knit the rs stitches that were previously under your contrast yarn joining in the round and pm for bor separate your fingers with 9 10 11 12 sts per finger for sizes two and four the stitches will split evenly 5 6 sts from the front needle and 5 6 sts from the back needle but for sizes one and three you will need to alternate taking 4 5 sts from the front and 5 6 sts from the back needle with taking 5 6 sts from the front and 4 5 ts from the back having split your fingers join the sts in the round k 8 rounds or to desired length cast off using a stretchy bind off seaming down the top ribbing use the long tails at the top of the ribbing to blanket stitch the edges to the side of the mitten this is optional but creates a much better fit and look self assessment & comments finishing weave in all loose ends and block the mittens if you chose to make convertibel mittens you may want to add a small loop of yarn to the top of the mitt and a button on the cable side to allow you to secure the flap show me what you made #colwithmittens ig @knit off size 1 - right mitten key size 1 - left mitten key size 2 - right mitten key size 2 - left mitten key size 3 - right mitten key size 3 - left mitten key size 4 - right mitten key size 4 - left mitten key
